text.__SUMMARY__: Conus magnificus, common name the "magnificent cone", is a species of predatory sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails, cone shells or cones.The subspecies Conus magnificus macilentus Lauer, 1989is a synonym of Conus episcopatus da Motta, 1982
text.Distribution: This is a marine Indo-Pacific species, excluding Hawaii; also off Australia (Queensland)
text.Shell description: The size of the shell varies between 55 mm and 92 mm. The shell is intricately marked with a white ground color overlaid with brown to red brown.
text.References:
